result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin David Halvorson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Justin David Halvorson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Justin David Halvorson was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B", Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin David Halvorson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Installment Payment Agreement for Fine or Forfeiture.
Pay $50 per month beginning 01-14-2017  Failure to pay will be one day in jail for every $50 or part thereof that remains unpaid with Huber consecutive to any other time being served.

Justin David Halvorson, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Richard Russell Mccue.
Jeffrey Duane Kohl appeared as prosecuting attorney. Defendant pleads no contest to count 1. found guilty and sentenced to $100 plus costs. count 2 dismissed on prosecutor's motion. DNA surcharge waived, DNA already on file.

Justin David Halvorson, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Richard Russell Mccue.
Jeffrey Duane Kohl appeared as prosecuting attorney.

Justin David Halvorson, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Guy Mason Taylor.
Jeffrey Duane Kohl appeared as prosecuting attorney. Bond conditions amended to read "No contact with NRK. Exchange of Child, DDH to be through a 3rd party (Defendant's mother or someone else)" All other conditions to remain the same.

Justin David Halvorson, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Guy Mason Taylor.
Jeffrey Duane Kohl appeared as prosecuting attorney.   Court advises defendant of rights.  Defendant given complaint. Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Court advises defendant of charges and penalties.  Defendant stands mute, Court enters not guilty plea on defendants behalf. Cash bond to be refunded. Pre-trial conference set for 11-15-16 at 8:30.

NO CONTACT WITH: N.R.K..  Must have exchange of the child, D.D.H. through a 3rd party adult - can be defendant's mother.  Violation: Disorderly Conduct (Domestic Violence), Knowlingly violated a domestic abuse order-injunction.  Iss. Agency: Brodhead Police Dept.
